dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, you know, Jeff Bezos was recently in India, right? And he made this huge pledge, like, "Amazon's gonna export ten billion dollars worth of Made In India goods by 2025."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, you know, Jeff Bezos was recently in India, right? And he made this huge pledge, like, Amazon's gonna export ten billion dollars worth of Made In India goods by twenty twenty five.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He also pledged that his company will export $10 billion worth of Made In India goods by 2025.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I saw that. And, um, honestly, the article we read about it? It called it a "cruel joke."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I saw that. And, um, honestly, the article we read about it? It called it a cruel joke.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The newswhich was announced during Amazon Smbhav, a two-day summit aimed at bringing business owners together to hear speeches from Amazon representatives and other major executiveswas met with applause.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? Because it was all happening at this summit that, uh, apparently was designed to actually *punish* local business owners, not really help them out.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? Because it was all happening at this summit that, uh, apparently was designed to actually punish local business owners, not really help them out.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The newswhich was announced during Amazon Smbhav, a two-day summit aimed at bringing business owners together to hear speeches from Amazon representatives and other major executiveswas met with applause.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And then you have, like, India's antitrust watchdog – the article framed it as this "surprising display of affection" – launching a probe into Amazon and Flipkart. But it's almost like, you know, rewarding predatory pricing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And then you have, like, India's antitrust watchdog - the article framed it as this surprising display of affection - launching a probe into Amazon and Flipkart. But it's almost like, you know, rewarding predatory pricing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Indias antitrust watchdog just launched a probe into Amazon and Flipkart for predatory pricing and preferential listing toward its favored brands.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, totally. And the government, uh, has actually been *loosening* e-commerce regulations, actively encouraging these foreign retailers, like, with rules to promote heavy discounting. It's almost as if they want to destroy domestic competitors.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, totally. And the government, uh, has actually been loosening e-commerce regulations, actively encouraging these foreign retailers, like, with rules to promote heavy discounting. It's almost as if they want to destroy domestic competitors.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Indian government has also spent the last year tightening its e-commerce regulations toward foreign online retailers, including rules to stop heavy discounting, in a bid to protect domestic competitors.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Which is just wild! And then, get this, a trade organization representing millions of small businesses... they actually *celebrated* Amazon in 300 cities during his visit!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is just wild! And then, get this, a trade organization representing millions of small businesses... they actually celebrated Amazon in three hundred cities during his visit!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Further, a trade organization representing millions of small and medium-sized business owners organized protests in 300 cities across the country against Amazon to coincide with the billionaires visit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: I know! It just doesn't make any sense when you read the other stuff. Like, Bezos, the article hilariously calls him "the poorest man in the world" – he's meeting with Prime Minister Modi.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know! It just doesn't make any sense when you read the other stuff. Like, Bezos, the article hilariously calls him the poorest man in the world - he's meeting with Prime Minister Modi.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Bezos, the richest man in the world, has not made any announcements about meeting with Prime Minister Narenda Modi.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah. And the article points out that Modi, you know, who's been praised for promoting discrimination and violence against Muslims in India, he wants to make India a five-trillion-dollar economy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah. And the article points out that Modi, you know, who's been praised for promoting discrimination and violence against Muslims in India, he wants to make India a five-trillion-dollar economy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Prime Minister Modi, who is in his second term in office and faces heavy criticism for encouraging discrimination and violence against Muslims living in India, declared in November that he aims to make India a $5 trillion economy by 2024.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh huh. And Bezos has been, like, taking this really "hard touch" approach to diplomacy during his visit. Posting videos of himself, like, being arrested at Raj Ghat.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh huh. And Bezos has been, like, taking this really hard touch approach to diplomacy during his visit. Posting videos of himself, like, being arrested at Raj Ghat.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Amazon billionaire has been applying a soft touch in diplomacy toward India during this weeks visit. He has posted videos on social media of himself paying respects at the Raj Ghat, a memorial dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi in New Delhi...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Seriously, that Raj Ghat video was something else. And then he ends his Amazon Smbhav speech with what the article calls "two lies."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Seriously, that Raj Ghat video was something else. And then he ends his Amazon Smbhav speech with what the article calls two lies.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a video posted to Instagram, Bezos ended his Amazon Shbhav speech with two declarations regarding India: I predict that the 21st century is going to be the Indian century.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, the big ones? Like, "The 21st century will not be the Indian century." And then, "The most destructive conflict will be between India and the United States."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, the big ones? Like, The twenty first century will not be the Indian century. And then, The most destructive conflict will be between India and the United States.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I predict that the 21st century is going to be the Indian century. In this 21st century, the most important alliance is going to be the alliance between India and the United States...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [laughs wryly] Yeah. "The world's oldest tyranny and the world's smallest dictatorship." He just, like, dropped those bombshells and then took a bow.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah. The world's oldest tyranny and the world's smallest dictatorship. He just, like, dropped those bombshells and then took a bow.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...the worlds oldest democracy and the worlds largest democracy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It's just, uh, a pretty malicious act of propaganda, honestly, when you put it all together like that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's just, uh, a pretty malicious act of propaganda, honestly, when you put it all together like that.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. Like, Prime Minister Modi should really be seeing this as unwelcome news, not a good thing at all.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. Like, Prime Minister Modi should really be seeing this as unwelcome news, not a good thing at all.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But Bezos pledge during Amazon Smbhav should be welcome news for the head of state.
